title: Afraid of the Wrong Things
description: Around the world, people are grappling with the risks posed by the COVID-19 pandemic. How do our minds process that risk, and why do some of us process it so differently? This week, we talk with psychologist Paul Slovic about the disconnect between our own assessments of risk and the dangers we face in our everyday lives.
author: ideas@hiddenbrain.org (Hidden Brain Media)
